title: About Me
text:
I was born and raised in San Diego and have lived all of my life within the most southern county in California. Growing up in San Diego has been one of the biggest blessings in my life and I feel so grateful to have lived close to family and friends. My parents were also born and raised in San Diego and met at San Diego State University in the late 90s and decided to raise my sister and I here next to grandparents, aunts, uncles, and cousins.
One of my favorite parts of living here is being so close to the beach. My childhood and adolescence were spent swimming in the sea, catching waves, exploring tide pools, and soaking up the sun. The beach is my favorite place to be and I go as often as I can.





San Diego coastline


View of San Diego coastline from La Jolla Scenic Beach Trail




Family pictures


My mom, dad, sister and me at Windansea Beach c. 2012

title: About Me
text:
Environmental Education
My dad has been a middle school science teacher my whole life and has rooted in me a passion for education and learning
In my third and fourth year, I have taken several courses in environmental and science education.

title: About Me
text:
Restoration
I am also passionate about habitat restoration and the re-wilding natural places. I have taken courses like “Conservation Planning”, “Restoration Skills”, and “Biodiversity & Conservation Biology” which have taught me about what it means to conserve habitats for both the species that live there and the people who derive ecosystem services from natural spaces.
I have also worked as a Student Restoration Worker at the Cheadle Center for Biodiversity & Ecological Restoration (CCBER)
[insert pic of working at CCBER]

title: Madison Conrad
text:
Welcome!
Hi I’m Maddi! I am a fourth year Environmental Studies student at UC Santa Barbara, and I am excited to be graduating with a Bachelor of Science at the end of this quarter! I am from San Diego, CA and I have a younger sister who is also studying at UCSB. I love going for sunset walks, reading new books, and catching up with friends
